headline: My Favorite Chicken Salad
description: This savory chicken salad with crunchy celery and pecans mixed with mayonnaise, relish, mustard, garlic, and dill is delicious as is or on a sandwich.
name: My Favorite Chicken Salad
recipeIngredient: 2 cooked skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into cubes

recipeInstructions.text: Stir together chicken, celery, pecans, mayonnaise, onion, relish, mustard, pepper, dill, lemon juice, sugar, salt, garlic powder, and paprika in a large bowl until well combined. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

review.reviewBody: I made this with two cans of Kirkland chicken breast, and otherwise followed recipe exactly. A little heavy on the black pepper, but it was delicious! My new favorite.
Left out the sugar. Used sweet pickle relish instead of regular pickle relish.
Tried this recipe Luv it also healthy

My sister and I wanted to do a homemade chicken salad and a large batch of is so costly to buy it pre-made. I chose to do a whole chicken which I roasted with butter olive oil, salt pepper and garlic powder. I let the bird cool long enough to where I can manhandle it and ripped all the meat off of it and then chopped it up fairly fine. I followed this recipe for the most part but I like to throwing my own little spin on things so I went kind of heavy on some of the ingredients and I didn't do the fresh Dill. TASTES AWESOME!!!
I left out the pecans, and chopped up my chicken in a food processor but followed everything else as shown on the recipe. Very tasty and will definitely make this chicken salad again!
I cannot believe how delicious this is. I’ve never left a review and I’ve made dozens of All Recipe recipes. This is perfect as is, absolutely delicious. Don’t change a thing.
Very good, doesn’t need the pecans.

Made this for my boyfriend who loves Costco’s chicken salad (which has few ingredients). He said the flavors just didn’t mix. I think there’s just too many ingredients. It wasn’t “bad”, it’s just not for everyone. I would not say that this is the best chicken salad because of all the extra ingredients and the ratios weren’t quite there. Uncooked yellow onion gave this a strong onion flavor; sweet onion would be a milder alternative. I won’t be making again.
No pecans, and might go a bit lighter on the pepper. Good flavor, but I prefer another recipe.
This is an awesome recipe just as it is: perfect blend of flavors! The only thing I do different is to toast the pecans for that extra flavor. Great recipe!
Made for hubby & omgosh, it was the best chicken salad I have ever had!
Perfect blend of flavors and crunch for my taste! This will definitely be my go-to Chicken salad...no changes to the recipe at all!

OH. MY. WORD. I’m not usually a fan of chicken salads — the usual fruit just turns me off. But THIS is DELISH! I didn’t have relish, so left that out, left out the sugar and doubled the lemon juice. Also used dry onion powder and dill for those (smaller quantities since I was replacing for fresh). This will be a go-to recipe from now on!

This is excellent chicken salad, very flavorful. The only suggestion I have is what I will do next time and make a bit more of the sauce. Of course the size of the chicken breasts varies, but unless yours are fairly small the extra sauce will keep it from being dry. It is very delicious and easy and I will definitely be making it again!
This was great! I used canned chicken and sour cream instead of mayo.
Super easy to make and very tasty
Used minced red onion rather than yellow onion. Have also made it with grapes or dried cranberries
Left out the pecans but otherwise followed exactly. Absolutely delicious!
Didnt need to change a thing ! Absolutely my favorite !!
It was super easy and I usually add something to a recipe. I didn't add or delete a thing. I didn't have dill so I added some fresh oregano and it was great.
I thought this was very good! The only thing I'm changing next time is the amount of black pepper. I pepper almost everything but this had a little too much.
Really good recipe.
I 've had chicken salad alotta ways over the years. This is truly THE best . Thank You Nora. I'm not a chef , just a guy that has always liked Chix salad . Fantastic TY
Made with rotisserie chicken. Love this!
Too much dill and pepper
This is a delicious recipe for smoked chicken. I made it exactly as written but thought it was a bit dry (hubby likes things saucy!) So I added some sour cream. Yummy!
Super yummy!!
Fantastic recipe just the way it’s written! I used rotisserie chicken breast with this recipe once and it was delicious!
So great and easy! Loved the touch of dill
We added less celery, more onions, skipped the pecans and added horseradish prepared mustard for more kick.

This was delicious! I didn't have pecans so I used toasted slivered almonds, but everything else was as written. I was surprised that the sugar and relish were a nice compliment and I felt the lemon was important. I was expecting to not like it as much as a basic chicken salad but it was winner. Thanks for the recipe!

Best chicken salad ever! Made it first time Saturday. It’s Monday and remaking it. Husband and I loved it! Wonderful full flavors, great crunch and easy to prepare. I do not ever use sweet relish but it is great in this. Husband not a fan of nuts in salads and he loved it. Made a sandwich with fresh lettuce and tomato from our garden..heaven on bread!
I tried this recipe as presented and I like it very much. Enjoy!
I was sloppy on the ingredients but this was pretty good. Definitely worth a try.
This is an excellent chic salad. Make it weekly and put on top of greens with sliced avacado/tomato. No dressing needed! Thx for posting it!
This was excellent! Used rotisserie chicken and just winged the amount on the ingredients! So good, everyone loved it.

This is a great recipe. I didn't have the dill or sweet relish and still tasted awesome. Instead of cooking the chicken, I used already cooked chicken from the store that made it much quicker to make. Will make again and highly recommend.
This recipe is saved to my “favorites”!! Will definitely be making it again and again!
I love chicken salad and have had it many different ways. This is one of my favorites! So good!!

I would rate this 5 stars as I made it but had to make some modifications. I omitted the sugar and think this would be really sweet if I hadn't. Also I didn't add the pecans and thought they would contrast too much with the other ingredients. Making those 2 changes this is my favorite chicken salad recipe to date - lots of flavor! I'm going to try smoked paprika next time.

First I thought this was complex for a simple chicken salad recipe but it taste pretty good. I cut back on the sugar, pepper, dill, and mustard, used onion powder and almonds and added grapes. I thought I had messed up with the mustard because of high yellow tint. I’m use to a nice creamy white color. I would recommend this recipe and will fix again. (Maybe omit the mustard)
I lost my chicken salad recipe and found this one. I made it as the recipe stated and everybody loved it. Great taste and easy to make. This will be my go to recipe.
I made it just like it called for other than using dried dill instead of fresh and adding some chopped dill pickles - about 1/4 cup (we like more veggies). Will do this again!
This was deeelicious. I didn't have a lemon so used lime. And used my green tomato pickle in place of relish. Did not add salt. Had to add more mayo because too dry.
This is delicious! I didn't have pecans and we have one who doesn't like celery, but I think it would have been even better with both of those. Thanks for sharing.

This made a great alternative to the curry/fruit chicken salad I usually make. Doubled the recipe except for the dill and pepper and stuffed in puff pastry shells for a party. Big hit and everyone thought I bought them somewhere.

This is delicious! I omitted the pecans (personal preference) and used left over grilled chicken breasts from last night’s dinner. I tasted it right away and loved it without even letting the flavors blend in the refrigerator. One of my new favorites!
I have to agree with Don A cut the ground black pepper in half. Good salad but my lips were burning.
I made this for my daughter's baby shower. It was a great success. Very tasty .

We loved it. Followed the recipe but cut back on the pepper as other reviewers mentioned and my grocery store did not have fresh dill so I used dried. Perfect just the way it is, but if you like grapes, they would be an addition that would easily blend in to the flavors. Thanks for the great, super easy - make the night before - recipe.
Great recipe, I omitted the pecans and used Avocado Mayo. Everyone loved it.

This has to be my favorite chicken salad recipe I’ve tried so far. I used one large, drained can of diced chicken breast (approx 1 cup) & halved other ingredients. Didn’t change anything else. Will definitely be making again.
Delicious!
Made this twice. The second time I cut the mustard in half. Much better. Adding red grapes is good also.
SOOOOOO Good! I've tried many chicken salad sandwich recipes and this one is definitely in the top three of my favorites. It will definitely be a staple recipe in our family from now on :)

Was good recipe,had been looking for just a different variation of chicken salad I did walnuts instead of pecans and I used leftover chicken that I grilled outside with hardwood Turned out pretty good
Very good! We skipped the pecans since we didn't have any. Even my picky teen, who at first refused to try it, liked it!
I love it, has good flavor and taste!

Ran out of fresh dill so I used dried but still really great. Also left out the pecans since my husband doesn't like nuts in his salads. I used homemade avocado oil mayo.
A lot of flavor going on. No bread needed. We served with bread or lettuce and it was great just by itself, with maybe a bit of fresh tomato and a bit of dijon mustard.

I did not have pecans, so I substituted slivered almonds. Otherwise I kept it like the recipe. I did half and half yellow mustard and dijon. I like onions so I did 1/2 of a small onion, diced super small. I had huge stalks of celery, so only used two rather than three, diced up super small. When I stirred it all up, mixed it well, took a taste......My taste buds lit up with so many different flavors and it was delightful! I love this recipe. Truly deserves 6 stars!

I am making this weekly now! I don’t use the dill and I think I go a little light on the onions and celery. I also am a little liberal with the mayo. It’s a huge hit in my family and recently took it to a baby shower and everyone was raving and asking for the recipe. ????

Great recipe! Even though I omitted a few ingredients (pecans, pickle relish, dill, paprika) and substituted others (purple onion, red grapes) it turned out delicious! This is our new favorite chicken salad, thanks for sharing!

This is a good base recipe. Plenty of flavor. I omitted the sugar, onions, and pecans (didn’t have any on hand). Even the kids that don’t usually eat chicken salad enjoyed it. I put chicken breast in the crockpot with salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and dill the day before. It added a deep flavor into the chicken. I also added sour cream instead of just using mayonnaise, which makes a major difference. Will definitely use this recipe again. Thank you.

This is my absolute favorite chicken salad recipe! I’ve been using it for years. It’s great with smoked chicken(my fav), or even leftover rotisserie or oven roasted chicken. Be careful with the salt depending on how your chicken was cooked. I only use 1/4 tsp at most, and only about 1 tsp of pepper. I like to sub slivered almonds for the pecans sometimes, and to really put the salad over the top, sub sweet chow chow in place of the sweet pickle relish.
I made this vegan by using Tofurky "chicken" and Veganaise. I kept everything else the same and omitted the pecans due to nut allergy. DH and I both liked it a lot. Thanks!
Great chicken salad!! My go to recipe
I made this just as minus nuts, 1/2 tsp. pepper & 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper. The wife and I loved it, most yummy.
Excellent!
Very good! Best receipe I have had this far. However I did not use sugar as I used Helmans which was sweet enough for my liking.
Really easy...adjusted recipe for 50% more, no pecans and no sugar. Also used 3/4 cup diced dill pickle and 1/3 cup diced onion.
Very tasty seasonings. Added bacon bits and cheese cubes! Yummy
awesome! great taste, used my left over fried chicken breast.
Miracle whip and and it grapes it came out great taste real good and yes I will make it again thank you very much
Kudos for such a great recipe. The only thing I did different was substituted honey for sugar and fresh chives for onion. Very good!
This is a good chicken salad! My husband wouldn't let me put in the pecans.
Wonderful flavor. I’d bet grapes would work well in this dish!

Great base recipe, and it's easy to add or delete to your own family's taste. This is a keeper and wonderful go to recipe for luncheons. I served it to family and friends and they all raved about it.I didn't really change thins much, just added a couple tablespoons of sour cream. Enjoy!

My BF was less than thrilled when I said we were having chicken salad for dinner, but one bite and his tune totally changed. I served it on a bed of baby greens drizzled with a bit of honey mustard dressing, but it would be great in a pita. I left out the pecans and reduced the salt (personal preference).
I added garlic
huaband and kids love this! i use smoked paprika and have subbed walnuts when I don't have pecans.

I left out pecans. I decreased black pepper and dill to 1/2 teaspoon each. I also made a marinade from lemon juice, pepper, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, celery seed, paprika, dill, and 3 tablespoons butter. Rub it onto chicken breasts and bake covered 1 hour at 350 and 1 1/2 hours at 225. Chop chicken and proceed with recipe. I also substituted green onion for the yellow onion.

I read a number of recipes before I made this one. I was worried that my husband wouldn’t like it as he doesn’t like trying anything new. I was very happy that he really enjoyed it! Very flavourful and an excellent way to use up leftover roast chicken. I didn’t put in the pecans but I will next time. I will definitely make this again!

We really enjoyed this chicken salad. I used a rotisserie chicken, halved the black pepper and used dijon mustard. I didn't have any sweet relish on had so I just used about 1/4-1/2 c of chopped up grapes and I omitted the celery because my family just doesn't like it in salads. I also substituted pecans for almonds since that is what I had in the house. Came out delicious!!!

We loved it, I gave it 4 stars because I switched it up a bit. I did switch it up a bit and I used a dill yellow mustard instead of the fresh dill. I also added halved green grapes. Gave it just a little sweetness.
Would have gave it a 5 but the garlic was a little much for my taste. Will make it again minus the garlic.
This is AMAZING! Love chicken salad and this is great. Used sliced almonds instead of pecans because both my daughters are allergic and is still blew my family's mind. Total keeper!!!

This is my favorite now. What a wonderful, flavorful chicken salad. I made it without pecans (didn't have any) and because I had a limited amount of roasted chicken I eyeballed most of the ingredients. Delish. I didn't add the sugar after tasting, but put a bit more relish which worked beautifully. This will be added to my rotation especially since summer is here, even tho the calendar say May 2nd (88 degrees) :-)

Absolutely awesome! I was afraid of too much pepper and dill, so I cut them back to 1 tsp, LOVED IT.

Update: I swapped out chicken for 1 can drained, rinsed, and partially smashed chickpeas for vegetarian option...still DELICIOUS!
Wouldn't change a thing. This dish was superb!!
Very easy and good. I added diced apple instead of sweet relish.
Super yummy! Followed the recipe exactly but had to substitute slivered almonds for pecans. A great way to reuse leftover grilled chicken.
I personally added 1/2 cup of red grapes to this recipe. HUGE hit with the family and friends.
We liked this a lot! I used it to make little appetizer cups and everyone enjoyed it! Thanks for sharing. :)

Very tasty chicken salad! I halved the recipe (as I had 1 leftover chicken breast from a Costco rotisserie), used red onion, and dried dill (I think fresh would have been better, but I didn't have any). I had this for lunch on toast the first day, and had it on crackers the next. Would definitely make this again! Thanks Nora!
Delicious!
Fantastic. A real keeper. I did use stone ground mustard, added some red grapes, and forgot about the onions. The taste is divine!
Did not have dill but turned out pretty good. I had to add more mayo because it was a little dry.
This is an awesome recipe. I omitted pecans and instead of mayo I used Miracle Whip.
My fridge just got repaired earlier this week and I didn't realize that my celery had gotten frozen so I used diced cucumber instead. Quite yummy.
